title: Marketplace for Tuesday, January 13, 2015
byline: Nancy Marshall-Genzer, Sabri Ben-Achour, D Gorenstein, Kai Ryssdal, Bruce Johnson, Lauren Silverman and Nova Safo
description: Airing on Tuesday, Jan. 13, 2015: Aetna is raising wages for its lowest-paid workers to a minimum $16 an hour. Those affected are mainly customer-service and billing people. Aetna says it needs to attract the best people it can, and retain them, as health insurance becomes more of an individual-customer business. Plus, a new survey shows U.S. companies are increasingly using penalties to encourage their workers to join wellness programs. Why is this part of the affordable act so popular with employers?
